newsitem.title: BRAZIL: B Band sparks rally in Brazil telecom shares.
newsitem.headline: B Band sparks rally in Brazil telecom shares.

text.p: Brazilian telecommunication firms surged this morning on the Rio de Janeiro Stock Exchange as the winner of the cellular telephone B Band concession in Sao Paulo was announced, a bourse official said.
The Sao Paulo Stock Exchange, Brazil's top exchange, was closed Wednesday due to a public holiday in Sao Paulo state.

"The B Band concession prompted strong trade and price rises in telecom stock," said Ricardo Nogueira, superintendant of operations on the Rio stock exchange. "The strong premium offered for the Sao Paulo concession was reflected by the surge in share price of Telebras and Telesp."

The winning BCP SA consortium of U.S. telecommunications operator BellSouth Corp offered 2.647 billion reais for the concession, way above the 600 million real minimum price set for the filet mignon of the 10 cellular B Band concessions up for grabs.
Nogueira said volume in morning trade was above average at 81 million reais by 1300 local time/1600 GMT with federal telecom stock at 250 million shares.
He said Telebras preferred hit a high of 183 reais on news of the BCP bid, but then fell back to 178.50 reais, a 2.9 percent increase on the opening share price of 175 reais.
Sao Paulo state telecom firm Telesp preferred shares jumped 4.6 percent to 385 reais.

Shares in Ericsson Telecomunicacoes also rose, rallying 2.74 percent to 75 reais, following news that the BCP consortium would be using Ericsson technology, Nogueira said. ((-- Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151))
